creator: John Dutton Wright
description:
LibriVox recording of What the Mother of a Deaf Child Ought to Know by John Dutton Wright. Read in English by Rapunzelina. Wright, a pioneer in the education of the deaf, was a strong advocate for acoustic and auricular training. In this little book, he tries to advise the parents of deaf children and reassure them that there can be a successful and happy life for them. (Summary by Rapunzelina)
For further information, including links to M4B audio book, online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording.

For more free audio books or to become a volunteer reader, visit LibriVox.org.
subject: librivox; audiobooks;Teaching; school; deaf; lip reading
